subject: Re: A couple of questions from a newbie
msgSnippet: Hi John, I ve also been curious about the use of the half-t letter. This is because in Read s manual it connects mainly to following letters; the only case I
messageBody:
Hi John,

I've also been curious about the use of the half-t letter. This is because in Read's manual it connects mainly to following letters; the only case I found of it connecting with a preceding letter is for the word "out". It seems that Kingsley Read meticulously avoided such use of the half-letter, without ever giving any reason for this. In my own handwriting, though, I often connect it too preceding letters, like in "want" and "at".

As for that layout, assuming it's the same file I saw in the files section, I don't see any Quikscript letters on it at all, so I'm not sure what that layout has to do with QS.

Kind Regards,

Scott

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm using Jeff Smith's converter, and the layout map by Ray Burke. Thanks to both of you gentlemen for making QS easier to learn with these tools. I have a few questions:
>
> 1) Is it permissible to use the upper half of the T symbol at the end of a word (the [ key)?
> 2) What is the use of the Alt 0230 and 0231 symbols on Mr. Burke's layout map?
> 3) What is the use of the upper case W on Mr. Burke's layout map?
>
> Thank you very much,
>
> John
>
